Literature Review: Scanning transmission electron microscopy (STEM) has revolutionized the field of materials science by enabling the characterization of materials at the atomic scale. The advent of highly coherent electron sources, aberration correctors, and direct electron detectors has significantly improved the resolution and sensitivity of STEM experiments. This review aims to provide an overview of the various STEM experimental methods, focusing on quantitative data analysis and simulation methods, and highlighting recent progress in STEM characterization.
